sentence.Network_en: A bigger objection is that aggregation of the results invites distortion.
sentence.Network_cn: 一种更大的异议是把各种结果集中考虑容易导致曲解。

sentence.Network_en: Moreover, aggregation influences the outcome of chemical disinfection of viruses.
sentence.Network_cn: 此外, 聚集作用还会影响化学消毒的效果.

sentence.Network_en: Aggregation theory is concerned with the transition from micro - to macro - models.
sentence.Network_cn: 总量理论是研究从微观模型到 宏观 模型过渡的理论.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 聚合(Aggregation) : 表示has-a的关系，是一种不稳定的包含关系。较强于一般关联,有整体与局部的关系,并且没有了整体,局部也可单 …
聚集（aggregation）表示整体与各部分之间的关系。例如汽车与轮胎，没有了汽车轮胎依然是一个整体。

聚合器(Aggregator)：可以将一个或多个Sakai应用(也可以是非Sakai应用)的输出整合到一起。聚合器定位并管理屏幕的固定输出内容 …

entry.def: An aggregate amount or score is made up of several smaller amounts or scores added together.

example.ex: The rate of growth of GNP will depend upon the rate of growth of aggregate demand...
example.tran: 国民生产总值的增长率将取决于总需求的增长率。

example.ex: England have beaten the Welsh three times in succession with an aggregate score of 83-12.
example.tran: 英格兰队已经连续3次打败威尔士队，总比分为83比12。

entry.def: An aggregate is a number of people or things that are being considered as a single thing.

example.ex: ...society viewed as an aggregate of individuals.
example.tran: 被看成个体集合的社会

entry.def: If amounts or things are aggregated, they are added together and considered as a single amount or thing.

example.ex: Different economies, with different currencies, should not be aggregated to produce uniform policies...
example.tran: 不同的经济有着不同的货币，不应该视为一体以制定出统一的政策。

example.ex: We should never aggregate votes to predict results under another system.
example.tran: 我们绝对不可将选票相加来预测另一种制度下的选举结果。

entry.def: If a number of different things or amounts are considered in aggregate, or in the aggregate, they are considered as a single thing or amount.

example.ex: Expenses are deductible only to the extent that in aggregate they exceed 7 percent of gross income.
example.tran: 只有在消费总额超过总收入的7%时才可免税。

entry.def: If one team beats another on aggregate, it wins because it has a higher total score than the other team after a series of games.

means.word_mean: 1. several things grouped together or considered as a whole
2. the act of gathering something together

stems_affixes.word_buile: g增加+greg群体+ate……的→adj.合计的, 集合的
con一起+greg集合+ate……的→集合到一起→聚集的
e出+greg群体+ious……的→除了一般的团体→过分的
ag加强+greg群体+ation表名词→n.聚集,总合

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分离,隔离;种族差别待遇
stems_affixes.word_buile: segregate[v.隔离]+ion表名词→n.分离,隔离;种族差别待遇
dis分开+aggregate聚合→聚合的东西分开
se分开+greg群+ate使……→使……和人群分开→隔离
